channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Gobble, gobble: Why do Americans eat turkey for Thanksgiving every year?
Washington DC shooting: Which ‘Third World’ countries Trump wants to ban migration from?
What is Italy’s new ‘Michelangelo Dome’ air defence system?
Are UAE and Saudi Arabia banning Pakistanis?
Is Trump cancelling World Aids Day in the US?
Why Nepal’s new 100-rupee note has irked India
How Pakistan has mastered the art of projecting defeat as victory
item.description: Global military strongmen seeking to overthrow governments and install themselves as dictators must learn from Pakistan’s playbook on how to falsely project defeat as victory

item.title: Does Hu Yaobang’s vision on Tibet still matter?
item.description: According to Hu’s vision, Tibetans should fully exercise ‘nationality autonomy’ and truly be the masters of their own lives. Xi Jinping’s reference to Hu suggests that, even as Beijing pursues the complete sinicisation of its restive provinces, Hu’s vision has not been entirely buried

item.title: A tenuous truce: Can the updated US-Ukraine peace plan actually end the war?
item.description: Russia is highly unlikely to accept the ‘modified peace plan’ because the updated version incorporates key Ukrainian and European demands that directly contradict Moscow’s core objectives

item.title: Beijing’s latest provocation: Time to call the Chinese bluff on Arunachal Pradesh
item.description: The Chinese harassment of an Indian citizen from Arunachal Pradesh will impact the scope of possible rapprochement between the two Asian powers

item.title: Strategic bonanza: Israel and India unlock next phase of partnership
item.description: Israel’s innovation ecosystem and India’s scale and manufacturing capabilities create a natural synergy

item.title: Timothée Chalamet’s bizarre Marty Supreme press run taps into a deeper cultural mood
item.description: Timothée Chalamet and A24’s wild Marty Supreme campaign, from an orange blimp over Los Angeles to ping-pong heads in New York, turns film marketing into a joyful, viral cultural event.
